Title.En: From Waste to Worth: Harnessing Excess Summer Heat

Description.En:
“Vilniaus šilumos tinklai” is the largest central heating company in the Baltic States. The desire to be innovative, efficient, and competitive is inseparable from our daily operations. We constantly rethink our business models, technological solutions, and explore creativeways to utilize our capacities throughout the year.  

One of the key challenges we face today is the efficient utilization of heat during the summer months. Due to seasonality, the demand for heating drops significantly, yet there remains untapped potential. Market conditions, such as the low price of biomass and the availability of waste heat from industrial processes and cooling units, present a unique opportunity: we have the capacity to act, but lack a clear direction for the best use of this excess heat.  

Could the solution lie within our own sector, related industries, or even in entirely new and innovative applications outside the energy domain? Solving this challenge would help us reduce operational seasonality, improve efficiency, and contribute to a more sustainable use of resources.  

Our goal is to discover innovative solutions to effectively utilize excess heat during the summer season. These solutions can range from ideas within the energy sector to creative, cross-industry applications.  

The energy sector is a field where technological advancement and innovation intersect with sustainability and purpose. The solutions implemented in the sector not only affect companies as economic entities but also have a significant impact on the overall goal of sustainability and a cleaner world.

Title.En: Create and present ideas and prototypes

NoteLiteral.En: Create and effectively present innovative ideas and developed prototypes tailored to the requirements of unique audience.

PrefLabel.En: evaluate data, information and digital content

NoteLiteral.En: Self-sufficiently pinpoint a unique and impactful research direction, utilizing existing knowledge and acquired competencies.
Innovatively tackle complex real-world issues using the core tenets of challenge-based learning methodology.
Utilise effective teamwork and leadership principles while collaborating within diverse, interdisciplinary teams.

Title.En: From Waste to Worth: Harnessing Excess Summer Heat
From Waste to Worth: Harnessing Excess Summer Heat

MoreInformation.NoteLiteral:
[Syllabus](https://uais.cr.ktu.lt/ktuis/stp_report_ects.mdl_ml?p_kodas=INNOM010&p_year=2024&p_lang=EN&p_stp_id=) of the micro-module.

The challenge will be solved in the module „**Development of Challenge-Based Innovation**“ (6 ECTS, online meetings – 32 hours, individual and group work – 128 hours). The module follows the challenge-based learning method: engagement, inspiration, investigation, and action.  

The challenge will be delivered in the KTU virtual learning environment. When a student is enrolled in KTU, s/he will be informed by email on how to gain access to the challenge.  

The challenge will take place **from March 6 to May 29, 2025**. The scheduled meetings with the teamchers and the peer learners **will be held once a week on Thursdays**: March 6, 13, 20, 27; April 10, 17, 24; May 8, 22, 29. The meetings will be held **at 15.30-17.00/18.30 EET**(depending on the day). Please note that attendance is mandatory and highly appreciated by your team members.

The learners are supported by the KTU teamchers (faculty) and the partner company Vilniaus šilumos tinklai. The learner teams are presented with the challenge during the kick-off meeting, they are invited to do an interim presentation on the progress of their project in the middle of the module and the final presentation of the shallenge solution at the last meeting of the module. The final grade is passed/failed.  

After the successful completion of the challenge:

- In two weeks, a student will receive an email with the link to download the ECIU University micro-credential.
- In mid-June 2025, a student from other university than KTU will receive an email with the KTU Transcript of Records that might be presented for recognition of learning outcomes at the home university.
What is the best way to use cheap summer surplus heat of district heating?

Are you ready to drive change in the energy sector? Vilniaus Šilumos Tinklai, a leader in sustainable heating solutions, presents an exciting challenge for visionary thinkers. As the seasons change, so does the demand for district heating. Despite advancements in technology, such as biomass energy and waste heat utilization, summer months still see a significant underuse of production capacities due to low demand.

We invite you to explore cutting-edge solutions to minimize the impact of seasonality on heat production. Your challenge is to find innovative business models or technological breakthroughs that can harness excess heat during the off-peak summer months. Whether through developing new products, creating energy storage solutions, or repurposing heat for other uses, your ideas can lead to enhanced operational efficiency and reduced costs in the heating sector.

Why Participate?
- Your solutions could significantly reduce environmental impact and reshape the energy landscape.
- Work on a live issue facing the industry and see your ideas potentially implemented.
- Gain valuable experience in problem-solving, innovation, and sustainability practices.

Join us in this venture to not only challenge the status quo but also contribute to a more sustainable and efficient future. Let’s innovate together to make the most of every joule!
